WRITING.TEXT: you also seem to be super active in the community. all of you are great, but I see you around a bit. thanks to all of you for running this subreddit and keeping it safe.
Oh boy, I left to go to the gym just after Kala was telling Tarzan they were the same. Couldn't take it.
Thank you, it's much appreciated.
I started to get the sting in my eyes watching Carla save Tarzan today. don't think I could handle Dumbo today.

This is worded wonderfully. Shit happens. I'm trying to roll with it. Doctors, hospitals, labs, MRIs, spinal taps. As longs as there's an answer, it's all good. It's no one's fault. You put that into words very well. This is something I think we all need to think about sometimes.

This is beautiful and made me smile. It sounds like you've made so much progress and are really enjoying life. It sounds like your kids have a fantastic mother. Good on you for getting out of that relationship and even better that you are doing what YOU want. What you're doing sounds fantastic. Can I come over? :-)
I am currently in the same boat you were as a child. Books are great escapism tools. You've given me hope that I can still have a 'childhood' later in life. I'm just barely an adult right now, but I feel 60. One day, I will go on an adventure. And I will think of you. Thank you for this response.
This makes sense. Thanks for the validation. It really does mean a lot.
Considering I'm 18, that hit deep. Denial is a powerful thing. I hope you're doing okay.

WRITING.TITLE: [vent] I feel like I missed out on childhood.
WRITING.TEXT: I was watching Tarzan and suddenly got really upset. sure, I watched Disney movies as a kid. but I never got to act like a kid. I was always doing something wrong or "acting like a child". that's the point! I was a child! I was supposed to act as such. I don't know. the movie triggered a lot of emotions. Carla taking care of Tarzan. Kerchac not accepting Tarzan. i feel ridiculous envying a cartoon.
why is this tagged nsf- oh.

this is terrifying. I'm so sorry that your boss is blaming you. it's absurd. i has anxiety just reading this. on Monday, could you talk to HR? if your boss is brushing thus under the rug, this could potentially happen to someone else.
I'm sorry your Nmom hijacked that phone call. if you need to talk, we're all here.
thanks for the response! I'll mention it next time I go in.
Same boat, friend. MS and Parkinson's are in the works for a dual diagnosis, parents won't acknowledge it. I wish you luck in your journey. If you ever need to chat, PM me any time.
I understand completely. I'm so sorry you've had to deal with the constant disappointment. Hugs if you want them.

http://imgur.com/1gXZ7z9
Voila
You go! I hope they turned out delicious!
Front page of Reddit :)
Here from the front page. You succeeded.
Happening in Ohio, too. Had a friend of a friend OD and die. Be careful out there, ladies and gents.
Exactly. Gender, socioeconomic status, none of that matters.
/r/emuwarflashbacks
I totally understand. giving threats is totally okay to them, but rationality is off the wall.

it's incredible that they think just because their son or daughter being an adult doesn't apply in or out of. the household. I hope.you and your husband are happy and tour child is healthy and bright!
it's interesting to see the dynamic between an Nparent and their Nchild.
Thanks for the laugh.
Have I got some news for you...

WRITING.TITLE: "I'll be so much happier when you move out"
WRITING.TEXT:
Ndad said this gem the other day. I said that if I'd gone to uni out of town I could have moved out, but I can still move in with someone since I'll be going to uni in town.
"Since you're in town, you will not be leaving this house."
N logic. it baffles me
glad I can be of assistance!
I'm sorry :-( I offer you Internet hugs if you want them. pm me if you need someone to talk to.
that's the perfect description of the feeling.
I feel your pain. three weeks for me. so much pain. I couldn't stand up straight
very keyfully.
I know exactly the one you're talking about. It gets crazy in there.
your horses and your dog are beautiful. You also have them on a beautiful piece of property.
